blog.name: aceycook
blog.title: c l a r k e

summary: “A… definition of a hero is someone who is concerned about other people’s well-being, and will go out of his or her way to help...
body: “A… definition of a hero is someone who is concerned about other people’s well-being, and will go out of his or her way to help them—even if there is no chance of a reward. That person who helps others simply because it should or must be done, and because it is the right thing to do, is indeed without a doubt, a real superhero.” —Stan Lee

reblog.comment: “A… definition of a hero is someone who is concerned about other people’s well-being, and will go out of his or her way to help them—even if there is no chance of a reward. That person who helps others simply because it should or must be done, and because it is the right thing to do, is indeed without a doubt, a real superhero.” —Stan Lee

blog.name: ao3feed-thebigguns
blog.title: The Big Guns
blog.description:
Marvel comic and movie verse fan works from AO3.
_____
ao3feedmonster@gmail.com

title: Iron Roots, Gold Leaf
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2JZZL7z

by JacarandaBanyan

Tony Stark loved plants. He wasn’t sure if he loved them for any particular reason, or if it was love out of self-defense, the way he sometimes suspected his mother loved his father. He also loved robots, spaceships, and AIs, but those were forbidden.

Howard Stark was a mean, paranoid bastard, and he was convinced that Tony was a threat to him. At least, that was what he pieced together over the first several years of his imprisonment in the greenhouse. Howard would prefer Tony study less important sciences, like botany, rather than engineering and physics, where he might one day compete with Howard himself intellectually. More importantly, his young son was proving to be too great a distraction, and he wanted Tony locked away and out of his sight.

When Tony first met Rhodey, he was fifteen and trying to break into an MIT science building with a remotely controlled robot shaped like a vine.

Words: 21573, Chapters: 3/3, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Iron Man (Movies), Marvel Cinematic Universe
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Tony Stark, James “Rhodey” Rhodes, Obadiah Stane, Howard Stark
  • Relationships: James “Rhodey” Rhodes & Tony Stark, James “Rhodey” Rhodes/Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Howard Stark’s A+ Parenting, Tony Stark Needs a Hug, IMBB, Big Bang Challenge, Robots, Fire, Comic Book Science, Violence, Weapons, Abuse, Child Abuse, (of a fairytale variety not a violent one), fairytale tone

blog.name: rebelace16
blog.title: Rebel Up
blog.description: Purely me, and my random, nervy, nerdy, weird, insane, intelligent, musical self.

body:
No but like,

Everyone’s talking about how Thanos had to go get a specially made gauntlet to contain the stones and Tony just pokes some holes in his gauntlet and calls it done.

But guys

Listen

That gauntlet was designed to channel the stones power but not let it destroy Thanos. The only time he took damage was when he overloaded what the gauntlet could channel and dissipate while destroying the stones.

Tony could make his tech handle and use the stones, but he didn’t have access to what he truly needed to recreate the true gauntlet. Hulk is one of the most powerful beings in the Marvel Universe, and he took damage during the snap.

Tony died

Thanos cheated and if he’d used Tony’s gauntlet he’d be dead or seriously wounded too.

That’s how powerful those stones are and that’s what tony stark did.

blog.name: ao3feed-stony
blog.title: Tony Stark/Steve Rogers
blog.description: stony ao3 fan fic rss feed

title: off the deep end
body:
by elospock

Tony snaps the gauntlet. Tony is about to die in Pepper’s arms, while Steve watches.

Except, he is not; not if Doctor Strange can help it.

A fix-it to Endgame, canon compliant until Tony’s death, some rewrites of the canon and major characters death.

Words: 1649, Chapters: 1/22, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies)
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings

A fix-it to Endgame, canon compliant until Tony’s death, some rewrites of the canon and major characters death.

title: Love at the First Sip
body:
by Stonyburger

Tony Stark and Steve Rogers are happily married and have a twelve year old son, Peter. They live in a nice family farmhouse, similar to how Clint and his family live. Everything is just perfect. One day Peter wants to find out how his dads met each other and got together…

summary: Hope you feel better soon!! If you had access to any bit of Stark tech what would you choose?
question: Hope you feel better soon!! If you had access to any bit of Stark tech what would you choose?
answer: Thank you :’) and OOOOOOH what a good question!!!! I don’t wanna be super basic and just say I’d want a suit of my own, but hot damn that would be nice. The ability to travel, help people… and look sick as hell doing it…. but I suppose if you exclude suits I would want an AI either in a headset or to run the home. It’d be super helpful with time management and getting work done, and someone to talk to! Give me a Jarvis. a Friday. a Karen. a whoever. i want one.

title: one mirror (holding us deeper now)
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2F7N9aD

by DeductionIsKey

“All the things must end,” the magpie said.

“But why, but why?” And so it began again.

Peter learns a lesson of unbecoming.
